snippet: Mr. Rowen, a leading policy intellectuals for decades, resigned from RAND in 1971 after one of its two copies of the Pentagon Papers was leaked to the press.
abstract: Henry S Rowen, economist and military expert who led the RAND Corporation in 1960s, expanding its mission to include domestic policy, and who resigned abruptly after a copy of top-secret Pentagon Papers owned by RAND was leaked to media by Daniel Ellsberg in 1971, dies at age 90.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Rowen, a leading policy intellectuals for decades, resigned from RAND in 1971 after one of its two copies of the Pentagon Papers was leaked to the press.

headline.main: Henry S. Rowen, 90, RAND Chief Who Quit in Pentagon Papers Case, Dies
headline.print_headline: Henry S. Rowen, Ex-President of RAND, Is Dead at 90

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
